snippet: The release of the convicted spy by the United States would do nothing to advance progress on the core issues of an Israeli-Palestinian peace deal.
abstract: Editorial laments the emergence of convicted spy Jonathan Pollard as a bargaining chip in Israeli-Palestinian peace negotiations as a sign of America's desperation to keep both sides talking; contends proposal to free Pollard is a bad idea and will do nothing to advance progress on the core issues of a peace deal.
lead_paragraph: The release of the convicted spy by the United States would do nothing to advance progress on the core issues of an Israeli-Palestinian peace deal.
